docs.summary:
The wix-stores.cart module contains functionality for working with your
 site's cart from client-side code.
description: To use the Wix Stores Cart API, import `{ cart }` from the `wix-stores` module:
```javascript
import { cart } from 'wix-stores'

params.name: customItems
params.doc: Custom items to be added to the cart.

docs.summary:
Adds custom items to the cart.
> **Note:**
> This function replaces the deprecated
> `wixStores.addCustomItemsToCart()`.
> The deprecated function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes, see the
> [migration instructions](wix-stores/addCustomItemsToCart#migration-instructions).
description: The `addCustomItems()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the current
site visitor's cart when the custom items have been added to the cart.
> **Note:** When [editing a site as a contributor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-contributors), `addCustomItems()` will only work when viewing the live site.

examples.title: Add 2 custom items to the cart
body: // Custom items not added to cart
*      "address": "235 W 23rd St\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*        "address": "235 W 23rd St\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

params.name: products
params.doc: One or more products to be added to the cart.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - The updated cart with added products.

docs.summary: Adds one or more products to the cart.
description: The `addProducts()` function returns a Promise that is resolved when the
specified products are added to the cart.
Use the `quantity` property of each `AddToCartItem` object that is
passed to the products parameter to add one or more products to the cart at one time.
Use the `options` property of each `AddToCartItem` object that is
passed to the products parameter to specify the product options to choose when adding
the product to the cart. For example, if a product comes in different sizes, you can
specify the size that should be added to the cart. If the product you are adding to the
cart has options, you must specify which options should be chosen.
You can see a product's option information in the `productOptions` field in the **Stores/Products** collection.
You can use the [`getProductOptionsAvailability()`](wix-stores.html#getProductOptionsAvailability)
to determine if an item with specific options is available for purchase.

examples.title: Add products to the cart
body: *      "address": "235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*        "address": "235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

params.name: couponCode
params.doc: The code of the coupon to be applied to the cart.

docs.summary: Adds and applies a coupon to the cart.
description: The `applyCoupon()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the current
site visitor's cart when the specified coupon has been applied.
The cart can only hold one coupon. If a coupon is already applied to the cart, passing a different `couponCode` to `applyCoupon()` will replace the existing one.
> **Note:** When [editing a site as a contributor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-contributors), `applyCoupon()` will only work when viewing the live site.

examples.title: Apply coupon code "SummerSale" to the cart
body: *     "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*   "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*        "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

docs.summary:
Gets the current site visitor's cart.
> **Note:**
> This function replaces the deprecated
> `wixStores.getCurrentCart()`.
> The deprecated function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes, see the
> [migration instructions](wix-stores/getCurrentCart#migration-instructions).
description: The `getCurrentCart()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the current
site visitor's cart.
> **Note:** When [editing a site as a contributor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-contributors), `getCurrentCart()` will only work when viewing the live site.

examples.title: Get the current site visitor's cart
body: *     "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*   "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*        "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

description: The `hideMiniCart()` function hides the Mini Cart.
Learn more about the [Mini Cart](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-setting-up-the-mini-cart).
> **Note:** This API will fail when viewing the site on mobile because there is no Mini Cart on the mobile site.

examples.title: Show and hide the Mini Cart
body: // Only show the Mini Cart if the site is not being viewed on mobile
// After displaying the Mini Cart for 3 seconds, hide the Mini Cart

extra.description: Add products to the cart, then show the Mini Cart. After 3 seconds, hide the Mini Cart.

params.name: handler
params.doc: The name of the function or the function expression to run when a cart changes.

docs.summary:
An event handler that is triggered when items are added or removed from a cart.
> **Note:**
> This function replaces the deprecated
> `wixStores.onCartChange()`.
> The deprecated function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes, see the
> [migration instructions](wix-stores/onCartChange#migration-instructions).
description: The `onChange()` function is a client-side event handler invoked every time the cart changes. It takes a callback function which receives the new `Cart` object as a parameter.
> **Notes:**
> + Use `onChange()` in the global site code file (masterPage.js). This ensures the event is triggered when a change to the cart is made on any page.
> Learn more about [global (site) code](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-the-velo-sidebar#global-site).

> + The `onChange()` function can only be used once a page has loaded. Therefore, you must use it in code that is contained in or is called from the [onReady()]($w.html#onReady) event handler or any element event handler.
> + When [editing a site as a contributor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-contributors), `onChange()` will only work when viewing the live site.

examples.title: An event when a cart is changed
body: *     "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*   "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*        "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

docs.summary: Removes the coupon currently applied to the cart.
description: The `removeCoupon()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the current
site visitor's cart when the currently applied coupon has been removed.
> **Note:** When [editing a site as a contributor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-contributors), `removeCoupon()` will only work when viewing the live site.

examples.title: Remove coupon from the cart
body: *     "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*   "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*        "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

params.name: cartLineItemId
params.doc: ID of the cart line item to remove.

docs.summary:
Removes a specified product from the cart.
> **Note:**
> This function replaces the deprecated
> `wixStores.removeProductFromCart()`.
> The deprecated function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.
> To keep any existing code compatible with future changes, see the
> [migration instructions](wix-stores/removeProductFromCart#migration-instructions).
description: The `removeProduct()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the
updated cart after the product is removed.
Every line item in a cart has an ID. Pass this to `removeProduct()` to remove that line item/product from the cart.
> **Notes:**
> - `removeProduct()` does not decrement the line item's quantity, it removes the line item/product altogether.
> - When [editing a site as a contributor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-contributors), `removeProduct()` will only work when viewing the live site.

examples.title: Remove item with `id: 3` from cart
body: *     "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*   "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*        "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

examples.title: Remove item by `productId`
body: // Find the cart item by productId
// If the item is found, remove it from the cart
*     "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*   "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*        "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

description: The `showMiniCart()` function displays the Mini Cart.
Learn more about the [Mini Cart](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-stores-adding-and-setting-up-the-mini-cart).
> **Note:** This API will fail when viewing the site on mobile because there is no Mini Cart on the mobile site.

examples.title: Add products to the cart, then show the Mini Cart
body: // Only show the Mini Cart if the site is not being viewed on mobile

params.name: cartLineItemId
params.doc: ID of the cart line item to update.

docs.summary: Updates the quantity of a specified line item in the cart.
description: The `updateLineItemQuantity()` function returns a Promise that resolves to the current
site visitor's cart when the specified line item's quantity has been updated.
> **Note:** When [editing a site as a contributor](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-contributors), `updateLineItemQuantity()` will only work when viewing the live site.

examples.title: Update the quantity of a cart's line item
body: // Cart line item's quantity not updated
*     "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"
*   "buyerNote": "This is a note from the buyer.",
*        "address":"235 West 23rd Street\nNew York, New York 10011\nUnited States"

docs.summary: An object used when adding one or more products to the cart.

members.name: productId
members.doc: ID of the product to add to the cart.

members.name: quantity
members.doc: Number of product units to add to the cart.

members.name: options
members.doc:
Specific product options to add to the cart.
 If the product you're adding has options, you must specify which options to add.

docs.summary: An object used when adding a product to the cart with options.

members.name: choices
members.doc:
Product options to use when adding the
 product to the cart. The object contains key:value pairs where the key is the
 option name and the value is the chosen option value.

members.name: customTextFields
members.doc: Custom text fields to use when adding the product to the cart.

docs.summary:
An object used to pass a custom text field when adding a product to
 the cart with options.
